intro: Brosimum lemeei, commonly known as the white sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The tree is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round, fleshy drupe that turns yellow when mature. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
